td.content: s:67 yr old f retired presents with injured rt hip due to having received blunt force trauma. she reports critical lack of feeling in right leg and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 65 in, Weight 110 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 69, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 15, irreversibly demolished hip a:white f retired aged 67 Ys presents with traumatic blunt injury to RT hip p:administered dilaudid - 1 mg IV q 2-3h prn. May repeat if no relief in 30min, ancef - 1 gm IV q 8 hours, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and referred patient to orthopedics.

Term.SYMPTOM: Loss of capacity to feel emotions

Value.Value: E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,
orthopedics

td.content: s:f retired aged 67 Ys presents for follow-up on amputated rt hip from 2 weeks ago. patient presents with 7 days history of severe swelling at the amputation site and severe stump pain. denies any alcohol use she smokes 1 pack daily for 3 years o:Height 65 in, Weight 108 lbs, Temperature 98.5 F, Pulse 69, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 15, large wound, No bone visible in the wound at this time a:Disarticulation of right hip status p:performed Global postoperative visit - Completed, and prescribed vicodin HP 10-300 - 1 tab PO q 4 hours prn pain, ordered BMP, rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip, and referred patient to therapy, physical.

content2.Unmatched: denies any alcohol use she smokes

Value.Value: Global postoperative visit

content2.Value: Global postoperative visit
Complete

Value.Value: ordered BMP , rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip ,

content2.Value: ordered BMP , rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip ,

Value.Value: therapy , physical

content2.Value: therapy , physical

td.content: s:67 yr old white f amputation pt (rt hip removed 2 weeks ago) presents for physical therapy visit. pt reports no issues o:, Extremity = no redness, no pus, good strength; Treatment provided: 1. Aerobic exercise to increase endurance 2. Hip extension, Hip abduction/adduction 3. mobility 4. Balance 5. Skin care a:Disarticulation of right hip status p:Begin sessions every three days until improvement in condition. performed Physical therapy evaluation - Completed; rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip - patient tolerated treatment well, showed increased ROM and strength.

content2.Unmatched: weeks ago) presents for physical therapy visit
, no pus , good strength; Treatment provided:
Begin sessions every three days until improvement

td.content: s:68 year old white female retired presents for follow-up on amputated rt hip from approx. 13 months ago. patient with C/O mild phantom limb pain for 2 weeks that is frequent. o:Height 65 in, Weight 109 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 14, minimal erythema, Well healed amputation a:Disarticulation of right hip status p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed.
